link:labelLink.link:label: Summary Reporting Taxonomies
Identifies and provides information about one or more target reporting taxonomies to which the data represented in the document rolls up to.
Summary Reporting Taxonomy ID
Identifies a target reporting taxonomy so that, for example, it can be referenced in the [summaryReportingTaxonomyIDRef] data field at [xbrlInfo] level.
Summary Reporting Taxonomy Schema Reference Href Attribute
Value of the href attribute of schemaRef in the target reporting taxonomy.
Summary Reporting Taxonomy Header
An all-purpose data field where all the information necessary when it is too complex to be defined otherwise.
Summary Reporting Taxonomy Description
A description of the taxonomy for human use.
Summary Tuple Path
Specific filter for parent tuple structure. This value must be valid XPath. And the result of the XPath must be resolved to a node.
Detailed Content Filter
Filtering mechanism. This value must be valid XPath. And the result of the XPath must be resolved to boolean. If the resulting value is false, the entry must not mapped into specified facts in F/S.
Reporting Date Selector
This holds the concepts in GL data to create FS contexts. The value must be a list of QName. Each QName must be resolved to GL items. Order of the items defines priority to access.
Summary Precision Decimals
This structure allows to explicitly indicate the value for the precision or decimals attributes for a fact in an FR instance. Only one of the four elements in the structure has to be used.
Summary Precision
This item indicates that the fact in the FR instance has a precision attribute with the value specified in this item value.
Summary Precision INF
This item, when used, has no value. Its only presence indicates that the fact in the FR instance has a precision attribute and its value is INF.
Summary Decimals
This item indicates that the fact in the FR instance has a decimals attribute with the value specified in this item value.
Summary Decimals INF
This item, when used, has no value. Its only presence indicates that the fact in the FR instance has a decimals attribute and its value is INF.
Summary Context
This structure allows to explicitly indicate the context information for a fact in the FR instance.
Summary Entity
This structure allows to explicitly indicate the entity information for a fact in the FR instance.
Summary Entity Identifier
The value of the entity identifier.
Summary Entity Scheme
The value of the entity scheme.
Summary Entity Segment
This structure allows to explicitly indicate the information related to the segment in the context for a fact in the FR instance.
Segment Explicit
This structure allows to explicitly indicate the information related to an explicit dimension in the context for a fact in the FR instance.
Segment Explicit Dimension
The QName value must be resolved to a valid dimension item.
Segment Explicit Dimension Value
The QName value must be resolved to valid member item.
Segment Typed
This structure allows to explicitly indicate the information related to a typed dimension in the context for a fact in the FR instance.
Segment Typed Dimension
The QName value must be resolved to a valid dimension item.
Segment Typed Dimension Value
The value must be CDATA and a valid XML fragment and also schema valid against an appropriate typed dimension schema.
Segment Simple Element
This structure allows to explicitly indicate the information related to a simple elemtn in the context for a fact in the FR instance.
Segment Simple Element Content
QName for the simple element, if appropriate.
Segment Simple Element Value
The value of the simple element.
Segment Non Dimensional Contents
The value must be CDATA and a valid XML fragment.
Summary Period
This structure allows to explicitly indicate the period information for a fact in the FR instance. Instant, Period Start/End and Forever are alternative.
Summary Period Instant
The value of the instant date.
Summary Period Start Date
The value of the start date of the period.
Summary Period End Date
The value of the end date of the period.
Summary Period Forever
If the context should indicate "forever", this concept must be used. It accepts no value.
Summary Scenario
This structure allows to explicitly indicate the scenario information for a fact in the FR instance.
Senario Explicit
This structure allows to explicitly indicate the information related to an explicit dimension in the context for a fact in the FR instance.
Senario Explicit Dimension
The QName value must be resolved to a valid dimension item.
Senario Explicit Dimension Value
The QName value must be resolved to valid member item.
Senario Typed
This structure allows to explicitly indicate the information related to a typed dimension in the context for a fact in the FR instance.
Senario Typed Dimension
The QName value must be resolved to a valid dimension item.
Senario Typed Dimension Value
The value must be CDATA and a valid XML fragment and also schema valid against an appropriate typed dimension schema.
Senario Simple Element
This structure allows to explicitly indicate the information related to a simple elemtn in the context for a fact in the FR instance.
Senario Simple Element Content
QName for the simple element, if appropriate.
Senario Simple Element Value
The value of the simple element.
Senario Non Dimensional Contents
The value must be CDATA and a valid XML fragment.
Summary Unit
This structure allows to explicitly indicate the information related to the unit for a fact in the FR instance..
Summary Unit Numerator
This holds the list of measure information for unit numerator. The value must be a list of QName. Each QName must be resolved to be measure information such as iso4217:usd.
Summary Unit Denominator
This holds the list of measure information for unit denominator. The value must be a list of QName. Each QName must be resolved to be measure information such as iso4217:usd.
Summary Reporting Taxonomy ID Reference

Reference to the ID of the relevant target reporting taxonomy, defined in the [summaryReportingTaxonomies] structure at [documentInfo] level. Allows consuming applications to identify sets of [xbrlInfo] structures that point to a specific taxonomy.
Rich Text Comment
Accepts text in rich text format, including XHTML. It can be used for different purposes, such as to create footnotes in XBRL instances or to create a comment for a document or an entry.
Rich Text Comment Code
An enumerated code that identifies the purpose of the rich text comment. Enumerated values: link_footnote, footnote, source_document, source_journal, batch, other.
Rich Text Comment Description
Free format description of the Rich text Comment Code.
Rich Text Comment Content
Content of the Rich Text Comment.
Rich Text Comment Locator
An XPath expression that identifies the item that the comment relates to.
